original_text: Unlike conventional materials used in nerve tissue engineering, PAs can be directly injected in vivo into models and spontaneously self-assemble into nanofibers in aqueous solutions. Furthermore, PAs can function as biomimetic materials exemplified by collagen-mimetic PAs [92]. Conventional materials often rely on electrospinning as a manufacturing method to achieve fiber-like structures suitable for use in nerve regeneration. The self-assembly nature of PAs allows them to circumvent costly manufacturing methods. However, in contrast to conventional manufacturing methods like electrospinning where quality and batch-to-batch variability can be tightly controlled, merely relying on self-assembly as a method of large-scale commercial production is still an experimental concept. Perhaps the next step would be to carefully compare and contrast the robustness of self-assemled PAs to electrospun nanofibers. Given that the constituent elements in PAs and external factors like pH can affect its structural assembly, parameters must be finely tuned and optimized in order for PA nanofibers to be used as a full-fledged commercialized medical product [93].
original_translation: A diferencia de los materiales convencionales utilizados en la ingeniería de tejidos nerviosos, los AP pueden ser inyectados directamente in vivo en modelos y autoensamblarse espontáneamente en nanofibras en soluciones acuosas. Además, los AP pueden funcionar como materiales biomiméticos ejemplificados por los AP miméticos del colágeno [92]. Los materiales convencionales suelen depender del electrohilado como método de fabricación para lograr estructuras similares a fibras adecuadas para su uso en la regeneración de nervios. La naturaleza de autoensamblaje de los APs les permite evitar métodos costosos de fabricación. Sin embargo, a diferencia de los métodos de fabricación convencionales como la electrohilatura, donde la calidad y la variabilidad de lote a lote pueden controlarse de manera estricta, depender únicamente de la autoensamblaje como método de producción comercial a gran escala sigue siendo un concepto experimental. Quizás el siguiente paso sería comparar y contrastar cuidadosamente la robustez de los PA autoensamblados con las nanofibras electrohiladas. Dado que los elementos constituyentes en los AP y factores externos como el pH pueden afectar su ensamblaje estructural, los parámetros deben ser finamente ajustados y optimizados para que los nanofibras de AP puedan ser utilizadas como un producto médico comercializado completamente desarrollado [93].

Furthermore, PAs can function as biomimetic materials exemplified by collagen-mimetic PAs [92].
Conventional materials often rely on electrospinning as a manufacturing method to achieve fiber-like structures suitable for use in nerve regeneration.
The self-assembly nature of PAs allows them to circumvent costly manufacturing methods.

However, in contrast to conventional manufacturing methods like electrospinning where quality and batch-to-batch variability can be tightly controlled, merely relying on self-assembly as a method of large-scale commercial production is still an experimental concept.
Perhaps the next step would be to carefully compare and contrast the robustness of self-assemled PAs to electrospun nanofibers.

Given that the constituent elements in PAs and external factors like pH can affect its structural assembly, parameters must be finely tuned and optimized in order for PA nanofibers to be used as a full-fledged commercialized medical product [93].

injected in vivo into models and spontan.translated_key: inyectadas directamente in vivo en modelos y autoensamblarse espontáneamente en nanofibras en soluciones acuosas
original_annotated_sentences:
Unlike conventional materials used in nerve tissue engineering, PAs can be directly
injected in vivo into models and spontaneously self-assemble into nanofibers in aqueous solutions
.
Furthermore, PAs can function as biomimetic materials exemplified by collagen-mimetic PAs [92].
Conventional materials often rely on electrospinning as a manufacturing method to achieve fiber-like structures suitable for use in nerve regeneration.
The self-assembly nature of PAs allows them to circumvent costly manufacturing methods.

However, in contrast to conventional manufacturing methods like electrospinning where quality and batch-to-batch variability can be tightly controlled, merely relying on self-assembly as a method of large-scale commercial production is still an experimental concept.
Perhaps the next step would be to carefully compare and contrast the robustness of self-assemled PAs to electrospun nanofibers.

Given that the constituent elements in PAs and external factors like pH can affect its structural assembly, parameters must be finely tuned and optimized in order for PA nanofibers to be used as a full-fledged commercialized medical product [93].

.

.

. Además, los AP pueden funcionar como materiales biomiméticos ejemplificados por los AP miméticos del colágeno [92]. Los materiales convencionales suelen depender del electrohilado como método de fabricación para lograr estructuras similares a fibras adecuadas para su uso en la regeneración de nervios. La naturaleza de autoensamblaje de los APs les permite evitar métodos costosos de fabricación. Sin embargo, a diferencia de los métodos de fabricación convencionales como la electrohilatura, donde la calidad y la variabilidad de lote a lote pueden controlarse de manera estricta, depender únicamente de la autoensamblaje como método de producción comercial a gran escala sigue siendo un concepto experimental.
